=== Get Quickshot ===

If you are not using Ubuntu Lucid Lynx (10.04), the easiest, and recommended way to use Quickshot is to download the Quickshot Live DVD and boot into that to take screenshots.

<nowiki>[[http://files.ubuntu-manual.org/quickshot/ubuntu-manual-quickshot-i386-0.0.83.iso|<nowiki>[[File:download.png]]</nowiki></nowiki>]]

~-Please note: This Live DVD is a stripped down version of Ubuntu 10.04 and therefore will not be suitable for anything other than a temporary platform to take screenshots.-~

Already using Ubuntu 10.04? Add our PPA by running these commands in a terminal:

<pre>
$ sudo add-apt-repository ppa:quickshotdevs/quickshot-release
$ sudo apt-get update
$ sudo apt-get install quickshot
</pre>

=== Using Quickshot ===

 1. Open Quickshot (Applications → Accessories → Quickshot)
 2. Create a Quickshot user and login
 3. Let Quickshot set your screen resolution
 4. Download the list of screenshots
 5. Choose a screenshot
 6. Set your desktop up
 7. Capture, Compare and Upload.

Need more help? See detailed instructions <nowiki>[[ubuntu-manual-quickshot-help|here.]]</nowiki>
